comment.text: This translation key is used to display a suggestion for users who have selected a payment plan. The suggested action is to "Do more with" the currently chosen plan, which helps guide users towards exploring further benefits of their plan. This text appears in the UI as part of a payment container element.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'احصل على المزيد مع خطة {{planName}}' translates more literally to 'Get more with plan {{planName}}'. While not incorrect, 'Do more with' implies a broader functionality or benefit, which isn't fully captured. A better translation might convey the idea of unlocking more features or possibilities.

The translation 'Udělejte více díky tarifu {{planName}}' is a bit clunky. 'Díky' implies 'thanks to,' which doesn't quite fit the intended meaning of 'Do more with'. A more natural phrasing would convey the benefit directly.

The translation "Mehr Möglichkeiten mit {{planName}}Plan" is not ideal. While "Mehr Möglichkeiten" is correct for 'Do more', appending 'Plan' to '{{planName}}' is not standard German capitalization or phrasing. It feels awkward and might not be what was intended. The intended meaning of 'plan' is lost, and it reads like a combined word.
The 'Plan' is capitalized, which isn't natural in German, unless it's specifically a product name. Using 'dem' introduces grammatical correctness. The suggestion fixes this.

The translation 'Tee enemmän {{planName}} ohjelmalla' is a literal translation and doesn't quite convey the intended meaning of 'Do more with {{planName}} plan.' A more natural Finnish phrasing would be 'Pääse enemmän irti {{planName}} -tilistä' or 'Hyödynnä {{planName}} -tilin täyden potentiaalin'.
While technically correct, "plan tarifaire" is a bit redundant. "plan" on its own is sufficient and more common in French when referring to subscription plans.

The translation 'Կատարեք ավելին {{planName}} պլանի հետ' is a literal translation and doesn't convey the intended meaning of 'Do more with {{planName}} plan'. A more natural Armenian translation would emphasize the benefits of the plan.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a translation like 'Ստացեք շատ ավելին {{planName}} պլանի շնորհիվ' (Get much more thanks to the {{planName}} plan) or 'Օգտվեք {{planName}} պլանից առավելագույնս' (Make the most of the {{planName}} plan).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "{{planName}}プランの詳細 " is too literal and doesn't convey the meaning of 'Do more with {{planName}} plan'. A better translation would focus on the benefit, not just the details.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a translation like "{{planName}}プランで、もっとできる" ({{planName}} plan lets you do more) or "{{planName}}プランで、さらに便利に" ({{planName}} plan, even more convenient).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "더 많은 기능을 이용하세요" could be more naturally rendered as "더 많은 혜택을 누리세요" or "더 많은 서비스를 이용하세요". While '기능' (functionality) isn't incorrect, '혜택' (benefits) or '서비스' (services) often sound more appealing in marketing materials regarding plan upgrades.

The Dutch translation is identical to the English content. 'Doe meer met {{planName}} plan' is a literal translation and doesn't sound natural in Dutch. It should be rephrased to convey the meaning of 'Do more with the {{planName}} plan' in a more idiomatic way.

The translation 'Faceţi mai mult cu abonamentul {{planName}}' is technically correct but sounds a bit formal for a startup suggestion. A more natural and engaging translation would be 'Profitați mai mult de planul {{planName}}' or 'Realizați mai mult cu planul {{planName}}'.
The word 'тариф' (tarif) is a more technical term for 'plan' and might not be the best choice for a user-facing suggestion. 'План' (plan) would be a more natural and understandable translation.

The translation "{{planName}} සැලසුම සමඟ බොහෝ දෑ කරන්න" while generally conveying the meaning, is a bit literal and doesn't flow naturally in Sinhala. A more natural phrasing would be '{{planName}} සැලසුමට වැඩි වැඩියි කරන්න' or '{{planName}} සැලසුමට උපරිම ප්‍රයෝජන ගන්න'.

The translation 'Урадите више са {{planName}} планом' is a literal translation that doesn't fully capture the marketing intent of 'Do more with {{planName}} plan'. It sounds slightly awkward and not as compelling in Serbian. A more natural phrasing would be something along the lines of 'Остварите више уз {{planName}} план' or 'Максимизирајте своје коришћење уз {{planName}} план'.

The Serbian translation 'Uradite više sa {{planName}} planom' uses 'Uradite', which implies 'do' in a more formal or demanding sense. A more natural and user-friendly translation would use a verb implying 'get' or 'achieve' more.

The translation "升级为{{planName}}版获得更多权限" implies an upgrade, which might not be the intended meaning of 'Do more with {{planName}} plan'. A more direct translation focusing on the benefits of the plan would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 利用{{planName}}计划，畅享更多功能 (Lìyòng {{planName}} jìhuà, chàngxiǎng gèngduō gōngnéng) - 'Enjoy more features with the {{planName}} plan'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While the variable `{{planName}}` is preserved, consider if the phrasing around it feels natural in Chinese.  The inserted phrase needs to flow well with the rest of the sentence.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the context of where this phrase is displayed and adjust phrasing accordingly to ensure a natural flow.
